website_summaries.verdict: Carry this case at your waist, shoulder, or your back, thanks to a loop attachment that fits backpacks as well as belts.
pros: Constructed from Cordura nylon with padded interior
Quick-release buckle system and belt loop attachments that can be attached to backpacks, too
Interior pocket for small items like keys or drivers license
cons: Clips on the shoulder strap can accidentally come unclipped from the case

customer_reviews.title: This case is nicely made. Not sure what the fabric is
customer_reviews.text: This case is nicely made. Not sure what the fabric is, like ballistic nylon but softer, more elegant. Has some, but not a lot of padding; not stiff. It has a small mesh pocket inside the lid suitable for cleaning cloth and/or carry strap storage. The lid covers well enough to keep out normal rain showers. There are loops on the back for belt attachment. It fits my vortex 10x42 binoculars (6.25" x 5.25" x 2.25" w/ lens caps) with just a little room to spare, so you could probably fit something a bit larger. Probably not a 50mm set. Haven't seen anything better in a soft case--I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and Tighter Than Original Case for Viper HD 10x42
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement to the case that came with my Vortex Viper HD 10x42 binoculars. Although the construction is similar, this one is significantly tighter than the original. The 10x42s do fit in the case but with very little room to spare. The original case easily allowed my attached Viper shoulder slings to fit inside while wrapped around the binoculars. This case will not, however, there is room to put the shoulder straps at the top of the case as long as the buckle strap is fully extended. Would have preferred one with the same dimensions as original, but this one will work.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyB

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Selsi 7x35 binoculars perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a Selsi binoculars for $9.99 at Savers. Selsi's are a cult classic and I can believe why. Even though mine is an 'earlier' model that is made in Macau rather than Japan, the optics are absolutely superb! Super crisp and easy to focus to tack sharp. It came with a leather strap but no case, so I bought this Vortex case to protect this super find. The case fits perfect with extra room on top to fit the folded strap into the mesh pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Clevor

customer_reviews.title: Vortex Conventional Case is a Better Choice
customer_reviews.text: I sold my Vortex Glass-Pak case for this conventional case. The case primarily gave me peace of mind that my case would stay shut. The Glass Pak has a weak bungee loop over a small open ended hook. It easily pops open if bumped. The Glass-Pak case also has no room for the nice neoprene Vortex bino stock strap without forcing it each time into the Glass-Pak case. This case’s Pros: Solid locking flap latch, padded non slip shoulder strap (pad not shown in advertised photos of case), room to easily store the nice neoprene vortex binoculars strap supplied with my Vortex Viper 8X42, belt/backpack loops on back for better mobility if needed. This case’s Cons: none.
customer_reviews.author: smoinfo

customer_reviews.title: Small Touring Bag.
customer_reviews.text: The actual dimensions are 7 X 8.5 X 2 inches. Basically what you see here is what you'll get there. Well made. No sewing errors I can see. Comes with a narrow shoulder strap that clips to d-rings. You can use one of yours if you like. Black with a prominent logo. QR buckle closure. Padded. Light weight. Sturdy. While it won't serve the use I bought it for it will carry some essentials ashore on a cruise or about town touring. Ample room for mid-day meds and valuables carried under your shirt or jacket! Or maybe your binoculars!
customer_reviews.author: IMHOTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: It it far better than the case that came with the binoculars in ...
customer_reviews.text: This binocular case is well made. It fits my new Nikon 8x42 HG's really well. It it far better than the case that came with the binoculars in the following ways: It has better padding, better coverage of the binoculars, belt loops, and a shoulder strap. Both cases are well stitched together. Vortex just didn't take all the cost-saving shortcuts that Nikon did. I really like this case.
customer_reviews.author: liketoread

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. Fits my pawn shop find of Nikon 10x42 Monarchs with the neck strap attached and a rain guard.
customer_reviews.author: Oso

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection for my Nikon 8 x 32 binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, would fit taller binoculars as well. Padded, sturdy, good closure with snap buckle. Should provide good protection traveling and in the field. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: sgkritzik

customer_reviews.title: What I needed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased an inexpensive pair of binoculars but the case that came with them was too small. I found these & and I’m very happy with the quality & room allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma B

customer_reviews.title: Vortex 42mm pouch
customer_reviews.text: Vortex 42mm pouch, Made in China. Exterior size: 22cm x 16cm x 6cm Fit for my Porro type Russia Stem 8x40 binocular. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Henry Chan

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, fits 8x42mm binos quite well -- wish ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice case, fits 8x42mm binos quite well -- wish they would include this with the binoculars instead of the bubble hard case, which is too big.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Far better case then 1 w bino purchase. Great useability and convenience. Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: Far better case then 1 w bino purchase. Great useability and convenience. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Be positive to check the case is large enouigh for your item?
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice case but it was to small. I will keep it and use it for some thing ulse. I would suggest that they add the dimensions of the case to their discription. Thanks Don Lallier
customer_reviews.author: Thousands of Books Read

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my Vortex Diamondback 10x42 binoculars and it is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: iowapheasant

customer_reviews.title: Nice case.
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. Fits my Nikon Monarch 5 binoculars nicely. Looks and feels durable so we will see.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Much much smaller than the hard shell case. Great for saving space.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Like it...
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered, good quality and well built.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Too small for Nikon 8x42 Binocular
customer_reviews.text: Have no problem with the product other than the fit for Nikon Monarch 7 8x42 is very tight. It is not easy to pull the binoculars out of the case, takes two hands and quite a pull, and invariably pulls the lens covers off.
customer_reviews.author: CFHS65

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for an OEM case
customer_reviews.text: The OEM case for my 10x 42 Bushnell roof prism binocs had a flimsy strap and the zipper had failed. This provided a great replacement. Much more sturdy with a flap-over design, fits well (cinched down the strap a bit, but thats all), and the wider srap is much more comfortable and robust. Good replacement product.
customer_reviews.author: KiloTango

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like the picture and fits my vortex crossfire binoculars just right
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Garcia-perez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and fits my Zeiss Terra ED 8x42 perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Alexander IV

customer_reviews.title: The binocular case does it’s job of protecting the binoculars when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and weight. My new Mavern binoculars fix perfectly in this case.
customer_reviews.author: bill johnston

customer_reviews.title: Compliments my Binos!! Great Protection!!
customer_reviews.text: Went well with my diamond back binos! Perfect fit and room for bino straps. Excellent quality.. 10x42
customer_reviews.author: Juan Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Not of size stated
customer_reviews.text: Nice case, however not of the size stated at 9.3 x 9.6 x 3.1. Actual size is 6.5 x 8.5 x 2.5 and as such unusable!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Hoped for better
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as I was hoping for. Case seems to be pretty nice but straps seem to be very low quality. Also strap was rolled up and secured with a rubber band so tight that the strap pad is now drrformed.
customer_reviews.author: elnuttero

product_meta.title: Vortex Optics Viper HD Binocular Cases
feature_bullets: The Vortex Optics Viper 42mm Roof Prism Binocular Case is a replacement for the case supplied with most Vortex Optics 42mm roof prism binoculars.
There is an interior pocket which is a convenient place to store a license or keys.
It has a quick-release buckle system and a multi-function belt loop attachment that slips over backpack straps as well as belts.
The case is made from Cordura nylon with a soft padded interior.
